revised_title: Anatomical Observations on the Labyrinth of Various Animals
tldr: The author examines the inner ear anatomy of various mammals, including the lion, Indian gazelle, three-toed sloth, and kangaroo, and discusses differences in cochlea shape, perilymphatic space size, and otolith dimensions. The study also highlights the importance of perilymphatic space in understanding the relationships between different mammalian orders and species.
